hit_points.at_higher_levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per ranger level after 1st

option_a: A longbow and a quiver of 20 arrows

option_b: A longbow and a quiver of 20 arrows

features: Favored Enemy and Natural Explorer improvements

at_higher_levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per ranger level after 1st

option_a: A longbow and a quiver of 20 arrows

option_b: A longbow and a quiver of 20 arrows

description: Beginning at 1st level, you have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy.

features.name: Favored Enemy
details: Choose a type of favored enemy from a list provided.
Advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track favored enemies.
Advantage on Intelligence checks to recall information about favored enemies.
Learn one language spoken by favored enemies.

features.name: Additional Favored Enemies
features.details: Choose one additional favored enemy at 6th and 14th level.

description: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

features.name: Favored Terrain
details: Choose one type of favored terrain from a list provided.
Proficiency bonus is doubled for related Intelligence or Wisdom checks.
Gain various benefits while traveling in favored terrain.

features.name: Additional Favored Terrains
features.details: Choose additional favored terrain types at 6th and 10th level.

description: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

options.name: Archery
options.description: Gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls with ranged weapons.

options.name: Defense
options.description: Gain a +1 bonus to AC while wearing armor.

options.name: Dueling
options.description: Gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls when wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons.

options.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
options.description: Add ability modifier to damage of the second attack in two-weapon fighting.

description: By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells, much as a druid does.

details.spell_slots: Refer to the Ranger table for spell slot information.
details.spells_known: Learn spells from the ranger spell list based on level.

details: Use Wisdom for spellcasting ability, setting DC, and attack rolls.
Calculate spell save DC and attack modifier using specific formulas.

description: At 3rd level, choose an archetype to emulate: Hunter or Beast Master.

features.name: Hunter
features.details: Specialized techniques for fighting various threats.

features.name: Beast Master
features.details: Form a bond with a beast companion.

description: Beginning at 3rd level, use your action and expend a ranger spell slot to sense certain types of creatures within a specified range.
details: Sense presence of specific creature types within a mile or up to 6 miles in favored terrain.

description: At specified levels, increase one or two ability scores of your choice.
restriction: Cannot increase an ability score above 20.

description: Starting at 5th level, you can attack twice when taking the Attack action.
Starting at 8th level, gain benefits related to movement through terrain and saving throws against certain obstacles.
Starting at 10th level, gain the ability to create camouflage and hide effectively in natural surroundings.
Starting at 14th level, gain the ability to hide as a bonus action and avoid nonmagical tracking.
At 18th level, gain heightened senses to fight unseen creatures and detect invisible foes.
At 20th level, become a master hunter with the ability to enhance attacks against favored enemies.
